item.title: Tour of Go
item.description: basics Packages, Variables, and Functions Packages Every Go program is made up of packages. Programs start running in package main. This program is using the packages with import paths fmt and math/rand. By convention, the package name is the same as the last element of the import path. For instance, the math/rand package comprises files that begin with the statement package rand. Note: The environment in which these programs are executed is deterministic, so each time you run the example program rand.
